description: The h3cStackPortLinkStatusChange trap indicates that the link status
of the stack port has changed.

event.Summary: Stack port $v2 link status changed to $v3

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortLinkStatusChange H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackMemberID i 9999 H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortIndex i 9999 H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortStatus i 2
$SNMPTRAPCMD H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortLinkStatusChange H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackMemberID i 9999 H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortIndex i 9999 H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortStatus i 1

description: The member ID of the device in a stack.
variables.name: H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackMemberID

description: The index of a stack port of the device in a stack.
variables.name: H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortIndex

description: The link status of the stack port of the device in a stack.
up: The link status of a stack port with reasonable physical connection
down: The link status of a stack port without physical connection is
silent: The link status of a stack port which can not be used normally
disabled: The link status of a stack port in disabled status is
variables.name: H3C-STACK-MIB::h3cStackPortStatus

description: The h3cStackTopologyChange trap indicates that the topology type of
